Docs.summary: A node of the extension tree.

remarks.para: An extension node is an element registered by an add-in in an extension point. A host can get nodes registered in an extension point using methods such as , which returns a collection of ExtensionNode objects.
ExtensionNode will normally be used as a base class of more complex extension point types. The most common subclass is , which allows registering a class implemented in an add-in.
EXAMPLE: An application has a toolbar that must be extensible by add-ins. The application could define the following extension node type:
In the implementation of an ExtensionNode, the attribute can be applied to fields to specify which attributes must be loaded from the node.
The extension point could be defined like this:

example.code: <Addin id = "SomeApplication" version = "0.1.0" isroot="true"> ... <ExtensionPoint path = "/MainWindow/Toolbar"> <ExtensionNode id="ToolbarItem" type="ToolbarItemNode"/> </ExtensionPoint> ... </Addin>

remarks.para: An add-in could extend the toolbar by registering new nodes in the extension point like this:

example.code: <Addin id = "SomeAddin" version = "0.1.0"> ... <Extension path = "/MainWindow/Toolbar"> <ToolbarItem label="Open" icon="gtk-open"/> <ToolbarItem label="New" icon="gtk-new"/> </Extension> ... </Addin>
